title: Mother's Kiss
medium: drypoint, soft ground etching and color aquatint on paper
provenance_text:
Albert E. McVitty (1876-1948), Princeton, NJ, until 1948 [1]; his estate sale, Parke-Bernet Galleries, Inc., New York, NY, November 28-29, 1949, no. 207 [2]; Charles Sessler, Philadelphia, PA [3]; purchased by Department of Fine Arts, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1950.

Notes:
[1]. Albert Elliott McVitty, Lugt 1862c.
[2]. Sale entitled "The Notable Print Collection of the Late Albert E. McVitty." This lot, sold on the second evening of the sale.
[3]. The work was bought by Sessler for the museum. It was received by the museum on December 3, 1949 but was accessioned months later, on October 11, 1950.
